Key Findings

  • 90 contract notices published: Rossendale has posted 90 procurement notices on the government's Contracts Finder portal since 2017
  • Only 4 show awarded values: Just 4.4% of notices have a recorded contract award value — the rest show no outcome
  • £430K total awarded value: The four awarded contracts total just £429,756 — dominated by vehicle purchases
  • Zero SME awards recorded: None of the awarded contracts are recorded as going to small or medium enterprises

The Contracts Finder Gap

Since 2015, all English councils have been required to publish contract opportunities and awards on Contracts Finder, the government's procurement transparency portal. Rossendale has published 90 notices — but the data reveals a significant transparency gap.

Of those 90 notices, only 4 show an awarded contract value. This means that for 86 procurement exercises, the public record shows the opportunity was advertised but not whether a contract was let, to whom, or for how much. The procurement process effectively goes dark after the advertisement stage.

What Was Awarded

The four contracts with recorded values are all vehicle-related:

  • Motus Commercials: £178,245 — commercial vehicle purchase
  • Motus Commercials Derby: £119,827 — another vehicle purchase
  • NTM-GB Ltd: £108,109 — specialist vehicle/equipment
  • Watling JCB Ltd: £23,575 — plant/equipment

Together, these total £429,756. But Rossendale's total spending over the same period is £64 million — meaning less than 1% of spending is accounted for through published contract awards.

Why the Gap?

Several factors may explain the low award rate:

  • Below-threshold contracts: Many council contracts fall below the £30,000 threshold that triggers mandatory Contracts Finder publication
  • Framework agreements: Purchases made through existing frameworks (e.g., Crown Commercial Service) may not generate individual award notices
  • Administrative gaps: Updating Contracts Finder with award information is an additional step that may be deprioritised
  • Outsourced procurement: If Capita handles procurement administration, award notices may fall between organisational boundaries

The Trend

Publication activity has varied significantly by year. Activity peaked in 2023 with 18 notices and 2022 with 15. The pattern suggests fluctuating compliance rather than consistent transparency practice.

What You Can Do

  • Search Contracts Finder: Visit contractsfinder.service.gov.uk and search for Rossendale to see all published notices
  • Submit an FOI request: Ask for a complete contracts register showing all current contracts, their values, and expiry dates
  • Use the AI DOGE Procurement page: The new Contracts page shows all published notices with search, filtering, and analysis
